reviews.review_msg: Very unclear expectations; online participation worth 20% but based only on two sets of questions to be done in groups, but then only one group member was allowed to respond; quite snarky answering questions; unclear marking scheme for assignments. Overall, avoid if you can help it! Definitely don't take the online version if he's teaching it.

This was the worst research methods course I have ever taken. If you want a great reserach methods course try one taught by Chris Atchison. O'Rourke was unclear about how our participation grades were marked and a full 50% of the class lost participation marks. This course was simply a money grab by the university.Moreover, he grades on the curve.

GREAT prof!! He clarifies concepts very well and answers every question asked in webct discussion. This helps ALOT. He gives a lot of tips/hints in his answers on how to do well on assignments for example. Overall it was a great course.
Although his classes are demanding (no bird courses with this guy), he knows his stuff and communicates complex material effectively!
boring class. don't take it unless it's an requirement for u.
